means: 答复( answer的第三人称单数 )

sentence.Network_en: The correct answers can be found at the bottom of page 8.
They try to tease out the answers without appearing to ask.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们试图不动声色地套出答案。

sentence.Network_en: Mr Wade answers both questions with a qualified yes.
sentence.Network_cn: 韦德先生对两个问题给出了不完全肯定的回答。

PerfectNetExp.abs: the scientists rated answers based on spatial references -- where objects were described in relation to each other .科学家们对（受试者的)空间想象问题的回答（对空间各物体相对位置的描述)进行了对比分析。
There was another man who seemed to have answers , and that was Robert McNamara ., 另外一个人似乎胸有成竹 , 那就是麦克纳马拉.
listen and choose the best answers ., 根据听到的问句选择正确的答语.
she answers readily when called on ., 她一叫到就会马上作出回答.

list.abs: 大学英语四级常用词组 ... answer sb. back (与某人)顶嘴，回嘴 answer for 对…负责；符合… answer up 应对迅速.
大学英语四级常用词组 ... answer sb. back (与某人)顶嘴，回嘴 answer for 对…负责；符合… answer up 应对迅速.
answer_百度百科 ... answer worthily 值得回答 answer back 顶嘴，回嘴 answer up 清楚地回答，直言不讳地回答.
电脑常用英语单词 ... assignto 指定到 autoanswer 自动应答 autodetect 自动检测.
考试时将同时下发答题纸（Answer Sheet），所有答案均应书写在答题纸上，写在试题本上的答案无效。　　五、其他 　　大纲中的未竟事 …

entry.def: When you answer someone who has asked you something, you say something back to them.

example.ex: I knew Ben was lying when he answered me...
example.tran: 我知道本回答我时在撒谎。

example.ex: Just answer the question...
example.tran: 只回答问题。

entry.def: An answer is something that you say when you answer someone.

example.ex: Without waiting for an answer, he turned and went in through the door...
example.tran: 未等答复，他就转身进了门。

example.ex: I don't quite know what to say in answer to your question.
example.tran: 我不太清楚如何回答你的问题。

entry.tran: 接受反对意见;接受拒绝
entry.def: If you say that someone will not take no for an answer, you mean that they go on trying to make you agree to something even after you have refused.

example.ex: She is tough, unwilling to take no for an answer...
example.tran: 她很强硬，不达目的誓不罢休。

example.ex: He would never take no for an answer.
example.tran: 他从来都坚持己见。

entry.def: If you answer a letter or advertisement, you write to the person who wrote it.

example.ex: Did he answer your letter?...
example.tran: 他给你回信了吗？

example.ex: She answered an advert for a job as a cook.
example.tran: 她看到一则招聘厨师的广告后写信应征。

entry.def: An answer is a letter that you write to someone who has written to you.

example.ex: I wrote to him but I never had an answer back...
example.tran: 我写了信给他，但一直没收到回信。

example.ex: She wrote to Roosevelt's secretary in answer to his letter of the day before.
example.tran: 她写了信给罗斯福的秘书，回复罗斯福前一天的来信。

entry.def: When you answer the telephone, you pick it up when it rings. When you answer the door, you open it when you hear a knock or the bell.

example.ex: She answered her phone on the first ring...
example.tran: 电话刚一响，她就接了。

example.ex: A middle-aged woman answered the door.
example.tran: 一个中年妇女应声开了门。

entry.def: An answer to a problem is a solution to it.

example.ex: There are no easy answers to the problems facing the economy...
example.tran: 解决经济所面临的问题并非易事。

example.ex: Prison is not the answer for most young offenders...
example.tran: 就大多数年轻的犯法者来说，把他们关进监狱不是解决问题的办法。

entry.def: Someone's answer to a question in a test or quiz is what they write or say in an attempt to give the facts that are asked for. The answer to a question is the fact that was asked for.

example.ex: Simply marking an answer wrong will not help the pupil to get future examples correct...
example.tran: 仅仅在答案上打叉号不会有助于学生做对日后的题目。

example.ex: Below are printed the answers to the Brain of Soccer 1993 quiz.
example.tran: 以下所印的是1993年“脑力足球”小测验的答案。

entry.def: When you answer a question in a test or quiz, you write or say something in an attempt to give the facts that are asked for.

example.ex: To obtain her degree, she answered 81 questions over 10 papers.
example.tran: 为获得学位，她回答了10页纸上的81个问题。

entry.def: Your answer to something that someone has said or done is what you say or do in response to it or in defence of yourself.

example.ex: In answer to speculation that she wouldn't finish the race, she boldly declared her intention of winning it.
example.tran: 为了回应她会中途退赛的猜测，她大胆地宣布她要赢得这场比赛。

entry.def: If you answer something that someone has said or done, you respond to it.

example.ex: He answered her smile with one of his own...
example.tran: 他对她的微笑回以同礼。

example.ex: That statement seemed designed to answer criticism of allied bombing missions.
example.tran: 那份声明似乎是专门就联合轰炸任务的批评作出反击。

entry.tran: （某地）与…相似的东西，相当于…的东西
entry.def: If you say that something is a place's answer to a famous thing, you mean that the first thing is the equivalent of the second in that place.

example.ex: Cachaca is Brazil's answer to tequila.
example.tran: 巴西甜酒相当于是巴西的龙舌兰酒。

entry.tran: 满足，适合，符合（需要、目的）
entry.def: If something answers a need or purpose, it satisfies it, because it has the right qualities.

example.ex: We provide specially designed shopping trolleys to answer the needs of parents with young children.
example.tran: 我们提供特别设计的购物车，以满足带幼儿的父母的需要。

entry.def: If someone or something answers a particular description or answers to it, they have the characteristics described.

example.ex: Two men answering the description of the suspects tried to enter Switzerland...
example.tran: 与描述的疑犯样子相符的两名男子试图进入瑞士。

example.ex: The Japanese never built any aircraft remotely answering to this description.
example.tran: 日本人从未制造过与此描述有丝毫相近的飞机。

example.en: That little creep over there always thinks he knows all the answers.
example.zh: 那边那个小家伙老是以为自己样样都通。

example.en: She doesn't bother any more. She knows all the answers.
example.zh: 她不再烦恼，全都看透了。

list.explanation: (常用于否定句)彻底了解(一件事)

example.en: Even your doctor doesn't have all the answers.
example.zh: 你的病就连你的医生也并不完全了解呐。

auth_sentence.content: There are a number of answers I would give.
auth_sentence.res_content: There are a number of answers I would give.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: There are a number of answers I would give.

auth_sentence.content: I don't profess to have all the answers.
auth_sentence.res_content: I don't profess to have all the answers.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I don't profess to have all the answers.

auth_sentence.content: We couldn't think of any answers to that.
auth_sentence.res_content: We couldn't think of any answers to that.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We couldn't think of any answers to that.

Sentence.sentence: We're trying to get answers from the students.
With the teacher's help, these pupils were able to find the answers to their set of problems.

Based on answers to questions regarding their job hunting strategies and career decisions, he divided the students into two groups: maximizers, who consider every possible option, and satisficers, who look until they find an option that is good enough.
